content.description: Work through sharp and surprisingly shaped holds under the overhanging face. Either reach around the left arete to gain the slab face, or find holds far to the right with high left feet to reach hidden finger pockets on the slab face. The rest of the climb is a well-protected romp, however the opening 15 ft are unprotectable and contain the clear crux.
content.protection: Hand sized cams. 20-50 ft of slings or static line for anchors on trees above
content.location: Left side of the Lost Souls Rock

content.description: Weave side-to-side under successive overhangs, then follow the easy arete to the top. For a much stiffer start, climb straight through the first overhang instead of traversing left underneath it.
content.protection: Finger to hand cams and nuts or tricams. Long slings to build an anchor on the large tree 25-30 ft from top out
content.location: Start 5ft left of Beelzebub in a right facing corner under the overhang

content.description: An easy romp up the steep slab with both vertical and horizontal cracks to slip protection or hands into.
content.protection: Medium cams and/or a few nuts, long slings to build an anchor off the large tree 20ft from the top
content.location: On the right side, just inside the chimney formed with the neighboring rock, behind the climber

content.description: Negotiate an awkward start then follow the cracks of least resistance to a fairly blank slab requiring delicate footwork (and lacking protection options for 10ft).
content.protection: Medium cams and nuts/tricams. Long slings to build an anchor on the large tree 20-30 ft from the top out.
content.location: Start in the middle of the Lost Souls Rock, on the right side of the overhang.

content.description: A steep slab forming a chimney on the right end with the neighboring rock, and an overhanging prow on the left side, with a few climbs in between.
